benchmark_details.name: Enhancing Table Recognition with Vision LLMs: A Benchmark and Neighbor-Guided Toolchain Reasoner
benchmark_details.overview: The paper proposes a benchmark to evaluate the recognition capabilities of Vision Large Language Models (VLLMs) in table recognition tasks, highlighting challenges such as low-quality image inputs and introducing a new framework called the Neighbor-Guided Toolchain Reasoner (NGTR).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a benchmark for evaluating table recognition capabilities of Vision Large Language Models (VLLMs).
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Performance may depend on the underlying toolkit and the range of scenarios covered by neighbor candidates.

data.source: Datasets include SciTSR, PubTabNet, and WTW for evaluation of table recognition.
data.size: 15,000 images for SciTSR, 500,777 images for PubTabNet, 10,970 images for WTW

methodology.calculation: Calculating similarity between the predicted and ground-truth tree structures of tables.
methodology.interpretation: Higher TEDS values indicate better recognition accuracy.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments on multiple public datasets.
